definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Kelly: Did you hear the somersault marathon? It is truly straining.
sentences.chinese: 你聽說過翻跟頭馬拉松嗎？那才叫喫力呢。

sentences.english: They need to perform 6 figures such as spirals and summersaults.
sentences.chinese: 他們需要表演6個動作例如盤旋和翻跟頭。

sentences.english: They spin and they tumble. They bounce on the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 它們轉圈，翻跟頭，在微風中彈跳。

sentences.english: A heart doesn't need to do somersaults.
sentences.chinese: 一顆心，並不需要做翻跟頭。

sentences.english: Sometimes i would just role around in bed with my little dog.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我會抱着我的小狼在牀上翻跟頭。

sentences.english: He did a brilliant backward somersault.
sentences.chinese: 他翻了個漂亮的後翻跟頭。
